LimitDef_statement_fun_x.theoremContent: \forall f, \forall a, \forall b, (\lim\limits_{x \to a}{f(x)} = b \implies \forall \varepsilon \gt 0, \exists \delta \gt 0, \forall x, (|x - a| \le \delta \implies |f(x) - b| \le \varepsilon))

LimitDef_statement_fun_pos_infty.theoremContent: \forall f, \forall b, (\lim\limits_{x \to +\infty}{f(x)} = b \implies \forall \varepsilon \gt 0, \exists M \gt 0, \forall x \gt M, |f(x) - b| \le \varepsilon)

LimitDef_statement_fun_neg_infty.theoremContent: \forall f, \forall b, (\lim\limits_{x \to -\infty}{f(x)} = b \implies \forall \varepsilon \gt 0, \exists M \gt 0, \forall x \gt M, |f(x) - b| \le \varepsilon)

Continuity_x0_statement.theoremContent: \forall f, \forall x_0, (f is continuous at x_0 \implies (\forall \varepsilon \gt 0, \exists \delta \gt 0, \forall x, (|x - x_0| \lt \delta \implies |f(x) - f(x_0)| \lt \varepsilon)))

UContinuity_statement.theoremContent: \forall f, \forall I, (f is uniformly continuous on I \implies (\forall \varepsilon \gt 0, \exists \delta \gt 0, \forall x1 \in I, \forall x2 \in I, (|x1 - x2| \lt \delta \implies |f(x1 - f(x2))| \lt \varepsilon)))

UpperBound_statement_fun.theoremContent: \forall f, \forall A, (f is bounded above by A \implies \forall n, f(n) \lt A)

MonoInc_statement.theoremContent: \forall f, (f is monotonically increasing \implies (\forall a, \forall b, (a \gt b \implies f(a) \gt f(b))))

CauchySeq_statement.theoremContent: \forall a, (a is cauchy sequence \implies \forall \varepsilon \gt 0, \exists N, \forall n \gt N, \forall m \gt N, |a_n - a_m| \lt \varepsilon)

SupremumAndInfimum_theorem.theoremContent: \forall f, (f is bounded above \implies \exists A, A = \sup{f})

causal_inference_monoinc.theoremContent: \forall a, (a is monotonically increasing \implies \forall x, \forall y, (x \gt y \implies a_x \gt a_y))

causal_inference_boundedaboveby.theoremContent: \forall a, \forall A, (a is bounded above by A \implies \forall n, a_n \le A)

causal_inference_cauchyseqbound.theoremContent: \forall a, (a is cauchy sequence \implies a is bounded)
